Rajan Yergatwar : 
Hi Philips team,

IFA Berlin coverage please. We’re all waiting for it.
Jonathan Danyal : 
Does using keystone and/or 4 corners affect the picture/brightness quality in anyway?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Jonathan, no you won't loose any quality nor brightness!. Cheers
Nitin Sharma : 
Airmote is a Bluetooth or IR based remote ?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Nitin, the AirMote is BT and IR. Cheers!
Rahul Bandekar : 
Can I charge the projector with my 60w power bank.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Rahul. yes!
Talha Riaz : 
What type of screen would you recommend for best video experience? I mean grey matte or white screens? I mostly intend to use it with a permanent indoor screen.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello! We suggest matte white or a reflective paint!
H B : 
You say we can't use it as a bluetooth speaker only, because it is a projector. But the Capsule II is a projector and offers this feature. I see no hardware limitation that would prevent using this as a bluetooth speaker?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello HB. Yes there is a hardware limitation for Bluetooth function in standby mode. This is another BT module that needs to be on even if the projector is off. We can for sure have the projector turned on without the engine to be on. Maybe we can implement this in the future. Cheers
Hugo Cewers : 
Will AirPlay require a home WiFi to function or is it possible to use when camping?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Hugo, you can directly connect to the projector without router. Cheers!
Ludvig S : 
Will there be a way to use my mobile as a remote control to the projector? Like using the mobile screen as a trackpad.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Ludvig, in fact we thought about it, it's a great idea but... you already have a trackpad on the top of the PicoPix Max + the Airmote, 2 great thing to control the device!
⤷ Ludvig S : 
If I mount it so it points to the ceiling it's more convenient to use the mobile than a separate remote...
Is the Airmote IR or RF?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello, the AirMote is BT and IR. Cheers!
H B : 
Hi, do you have chromecast built in?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
HB, we have Miracast, DLNA, AIrplay and Youtube Cast. Chromecast is there only on Google Phone. but if you have a Samsung for eg, they are using Miracast.
⤷ H B : 
Actually, I cast stream content via chromecast from my Google Chrome tabs on my laptop, so it is not just for Android. Can I do that with your system? What is the latency?
⤷ H B : 
So yeah I just checked and I can't work on my latop while watching some streaming casted to the projector with Miracast. So it does not allow multitasking. Pretty bad to be honest.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
HB, if you want to do multitasking, better to use the USB-C or HDMI! Cheers
⤷ H B : 
... Or have chromecast built in. The point of a smart projector is to be ready for modern times and not use it with wires when it is possible. Not having chromecast built-in is a big problem.
⤷ H B : 
I mean Airplay allows it for apple users but you don't offer a similar solution for Android/windows users with chrome (which are not a minority)...come on.
Nitin Sharma : 
Is there any chance we can switch off the projector lamp and use it solely as Bluetooth speaker?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Nitin, unfortunately not, this is a projector :-)
⤷ Nitin Sharma : 
How does Boombox feature in screeneo projectors works?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Nitin, in standby mode, the Bluetooth module is always on so even if the projector is off, and has we have very powerful speakers on our Screeneo, the use case is pretty straight forward. The Bluetooth module is always on.
⤷ Nitin Sharma : 
It will be great if we can implement this feature in this projector.
Nitin Sharma : 
Is there any plans to build mobile app for controlling projector?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
In fact we thought about it, it's a great idea but... you already have a trackpad on the top of the PicoPix Max + the Airmote, 2 great thing to control the device!
⤷ Nitin Sharma : 
Mobile app can ease out use of projector especially when it requires typing. Most of the smart TV lack this experience of searching via text.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Nitin, yes you are right, but if you need to searching something on Youtube for eg, it will be easier with the Touchpad or AirMote rather to take your phone, unlock it, find the app, launch the app, connect to the projector, and start to type :-)
Ken Pachi :

⤷ Philips Projection : 
Ken, we received the samples but are still testing, we don't want to give non finished device to the press :-)
Aravind Chandrasekaran : 
What is the exhaustive list of video formats that the projector can play? Does it support more common formats such as the mp4. mkv, mov, mpg, avi,
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello there, yes all format, especially if you play them with VLC which decodes a wide variety of formats!. Cheers!
Aravind Chandrasekaran : 
4. Interoperability between devices: Most of the projectors support wireless streaming or casting from the device to the projector. However the wireless streaming option would mostly be for Windows device or Android device, and would require an additional device such as Apple TV or Airplay to be connected to the projector in order to stream/cast content from apple devices such as iPhones, Macbooks, Etc. Does this projecto have an inbuilt facility to do airplay without the need for any additions.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello there! yes we have already Airplay built in!
Aravind Chandrasekaran : 
3. Clashing of the Bluetooth output with Video streaming: Most of the time when a video is being streamed from a device to the projector wireless (Windows Wireless Projection, Android Cast, Etc) and the device is connected to a Bluetooth device for audio output. 99.9% of the times the device struggles to stream the video and would be unable to manage both the Bluetooth audio and the wireless video streaming in parallel. How does PicoPix Max address this issue?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
We never had this issue :-)
Aravind Chandrasekaran : 
2. Sometimes the video being played will have a poor audio quality or would not be audible enough. While we do have video players like VLC which solves such problems by increasing the volume upto 200%. And sometime we have sound driver/ firmware which has the feature of increasing the playback volume to 200%. Would PicoPix Max have such an option to amplify the volume to 200% or more which would be a life saver for many.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Volc is built in and you can even connect to bigger speakers via jack 3.5 or BT.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
VLC
⤷ Aravind Chandrasekaran : 
Whether with the Native volume control, the volume can be amplified to 200% using the supplied remote control. It does not matter what app that we use (youtube, amazon prime, netflix) or some other video player. If the volume of the video is low, can it be amplified to 200%. I feel this would be a great feature, since I faced this issues multiple times in the past and I had the only option to connect the projector to a laptop and then play the video on VLC and then increase the volume to 200%.
Aravind Chandrasekaran : 
1. The lens gets scratched over a period of time: This happens while cleaning the lens and despite taking good care caution. Sometimes even a cloud of moisture forms inside the lens which is really hard to clean. All of this will affect the projection quality and will project an image which is not as clear as when the projector was newly purchased. How will PicoPix Max address this issue? Is there a scratch proof glass or lens that covers the actual lens as a protective layer?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
We never had such issues in our past projectors, especially that our lens is inside the projector. If you face such issue within 2 years, we will take care this :-)
⤷ Aravind Chandrasekaran : 
I guess this does not answer my question, Its better to put a protective layer or scratch resistance on the lens or the outer glass protecting the lens. This way we can be confident and relieved that the lens or the outer glass will not be scratched. I am sure you are giving a 2 year warranty and such things will be taken care. However its ideal to prevent than to cure is it?
Aravind Chandrasekaran : 
I just joined as a backer to this campaign by getting a perk. However I have faced the following practical issues while using projects so far in my experience...
⤷ Aravind Chandrasekaran : 
1. The lens gets scratched over a period of time: This happens while cleaning the lens and despite taking good care caution. Sometimes even a cloud of moisture forms inside the lens which is really hard to clean. All of this will affect the projection quality and will project an image which is not as clear as when the projector was newly purchased. How will PicoPix Max address this issue? Johan Smedberg : 
Expect that it will have chromecast support for streaming audio output to audio groups, while playing back video content (presentations/music videos)!

⤷ Philips Projection : 
Johan, you will be able to cast from your phone to the projector via Miracast, Airplay, DLNA and we will have ChromeCast soon. But you won't be able to cast FROM the projector as this is a receiver, not a server.

Robin Boh : 
Let's face it guys. It's Philips. 
The answers are always the same. 
Not sure if I have the full list. 
1. No plans for stretch goals / perks.
2. No changes to hardware, just minor improvements to fan noise, what else? 
3.No Android TV since this is custom Android OS. So dont think of built in Chromecast. 
4.Want extra space? Use MicroSD card instead.
5.Want better casing? Sorry. It means adding more costs.
6. How is 800 ANSI color lumens compared with the rest? We are all waiting for reviews.
⤷ Robin Boh : 
Note: For the amount of money they have collected, it will be easier for them to reward the backers. But it is not happening here
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Robin, I remind you that the amount of money is due to the fact that 5214 backers joined us. The margin are very low and we offer the shipping.
We changed already the hardware by adding BT5, battery bypass, Widevine L1... 
Concerning Android TV, we explained since the beginning that Android TV is now our priority as many backers prefer to get Android OS. Furthermore, we need a special hardware for Android TV. 
Extra Space on ROM means bigger price, and extra tax in Europe
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Casing: yes it's a cost, if you go to a restaurant and ask extra topping on your pizza you will need to pay for it. As the discount is already very high, we don't have space to add more things. We really want to get the best for you but at one point it is not feasible. 
Concerning the 800 lumens, reviews will come as soon as we ship the samples to the Press. 
Hope this is clear, don't hesitate to come back to us if you have any other questions. Have a great day!
⤷ Robin Boh : 
I suggest that for better crowd funding communication and transparency as a company, do update the progress instead of replying every backer. 
So we don't need to see the same everytime.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Robin, we already launched an update several days ago with those info. Regards
Sa Mo : 
I've been following the comments and your answers for a few days, and it seems that you are pretty confident about everything but one. You say that your color ansi lumens was calculated differently than other projectors, but you still compare yours with them. So what is the truth here? Is your brightness measure comparable with others? If yes, why you named it differently? If no, then how to convert it in a way that it gets comparable with other projectors in the market. Thanks!
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Seyedamirhosein.
I think the answer is clear: 1000 lumens on A brand is different from 1000 lumens on B brand. If you buy 2 different product advertising the same lumens, you will see a big difference of brightness. So in order for our customer to get the idea of the amount of lumens, we measured our PicoPix Max and compared with other devices. If we compare to our PicoPix Pro, its much more bright and if we compare to other devices advertising 800 lumens, we are on the same level. Cheers!
⤷ Sa Mo : 
Thanks for the answer! Understand it now. I'm now heading to IFA to visit you and give the projector a look.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello there! I'm not in the booth today with the right proto, I will arrive only tonight but my colleagues are their to welcome you. The proto you will see is 2 months old and doesn't really work. It's just to show the size and features
Jan Steinbach : 
The Idea to add an hard-case as an *optional* perk ist good because the existing perk pricepoint for the projector is already very very fair! I dont expect and wont anything more than the PicoPixMax itself! P.S. Realy looking forward to IFA Content and live Demos!
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Jan, yes we will check this internally. Concerning the demo, we will try to show it to you guys but you need to know that for the moment only 3 LEDs are working, not 4 so the brightness wont be 100%. We are still testing and aligning colors/contrast and brightness.

So, it is safe to say that the 600 color ANSI lumen is equal to 200 ANSI lumen ?

Hello, this has nothing to do with our competitor. Whish you a great day

⤷ carljohan selke : 
no i meant the image source to the projector just like an xbox plugged in for the image only ?  the sound is splitted inside the home cinema reciever/amplifier to the speakers connected to the amp.

David Johnston : 
Excited to see the finished product!

Please excuse me if this has already been answered; I couldn't find it -

I understand that the device will support casting *from* android phone etc., but will it support casting *to* devices e.g. tablet or Android TV.? It could be helpful for diagnostic purposes, but also to access all the great features of the PicoPix; if the DLP engine could be simultaneously turned off to save LED life I'd be very happy indeed.!

Keep up the good work! :)
⤷ Philips Projection : 
hello David, the PicoPix Max is a receiver, not a client. So you cannot cast from the device to other device like TVs for eg.
⤷ David Johnston : 
Thanks, understood - to keep it compatible with protected content, issues would practically arise. 
For me personally, it was a hope that I could use the sound system attached to my android TV with the TV picture off, but I'm sure I'll find a solution for my needs.

⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello David, thanks for your support. Unfortunately ARC is not supported yet. Cheers!

David Duplantier : 
Hi,
Can I connect a Beoplay A1 via usb-c? If so will the internal DAC of the Beoplay by-pass the PicoPix one?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello David, no, our USB C is only for video and audio In. Best regards
⤷ David Duplantier : 
Ok. What kind of DAC is used for the jack output? How powerful is it? As BT has big issues with latency what is the best solution to connect external speakers?
Thanks
⤷ Philips Projection : 
David, the DAC used is the one inside the cpu. We are working with the Bluetooth module in order to get the best sync as possible. The best way is for sure jack to another Amp for eg.

⤷ Philips Projection : 
Bonjour Frank, après avoir consulté notre avocat, nous ne pouvons envoyer de biens gratuitement. C'est la loi. Il faut s'acquitter de la TVA pour un bien qui entre dans un pays. À bientôt

⤷ Philips Projection :

⤷ Jonathan Techer :

⤷ Philips Projection : 
Jonathan, no because this is not based on software but hardware component. The DMD from TI is not compatible with 3D. Sorry about this. Have a great day!

Longy Nguyen : 
Thank you for moving to Bluetooth 5! Hopefully this reduces the audio lag significantly from Bluetooth 4.2 and makes using portable speakers bearable. Optical out would be nice for digital connected speakers but I guess we can’t have everything in this first release.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Longy, We designed the PicoPix Max to be a portable projector without any very big wire connections. It is supposed to be standalone. However, we have implemented a BT connection in order to pair with bigger speakers. Unfortunately, the PCBA is now frozen for adding new components and to catch our schedule. Cheers!

⤷ Philips Projection :

Valentin Goncalves : 
Hi Philips, congrats for the 2M ! I think we deserve to get more AINSI LUMENS for the lamp as the actual one is quiet a bit low.. !
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Valentin, we cannot add more lumens like adding sugar in a cake :-). Addind more lumens means: changing the TI DMD engine, means getting a bigger engine, bigger product, more consuming and more expensive. Cheers!

Brendon McCarthy : 
With the "official" news on Widevine, will all Widevine apps like Netflix, Amazon Prime, Hulu, HBO, Disney, etc. be supported? Will any of these be "native" apps installed by default? Aptoide app store support is mentioned, but assuming any app store can be sideloaded, including Google Play? Finally, could Android TV be sideloaded via the APKs and run on top of the custom Android (I know its not for everyone but I like it)?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Brendon, we don't know if Disney or the new apps will be compatible as they are not out here. We will test in the future but they won't be pré installed. A lot of apps are country sensitive and we cannot load all of them. You will be able to load it from the store or direct apk. More over you cannot install android TV as it requires a special cpu and is like a new operating system. Like trying to install MacOs on a Pc. Cheers!
⤷ Brendon McCarthy : 
Thanks for the reply. Amazon Prime, Hulu, Disney, HBO all have current apps that could be tested before launch to confirm compatibility :) For app stores, Google Play (https://www.apkmirror.com/apk/google-inc/google-play-store/) could also be tested? Or any of the more secure third-party stores like F-Droid, APKPure. RE: Android TV, the concern is if apps will be TV friendly, Android TV apps are designed for TV (e.g. https://www.apkmirror.com/apk/google-inc/youtube-for-android-tv-android-tv/).

⤷ Philips Projection : 
Austin, we have already Express vpn installed with a great deal coming but it’s up to you to use your own!

Jan Steinbach : 
Bluetooth 4.1 / 5.0: Can you give an estimation how far the distance can be between the PicoPixMax and the Bluetooth Receiver? Bluetooth audio signal ist 2channel/Stereo only or?

(My speakers are off course in the same room as the PicoPixMax, but the AV-R/Bluetooth Receiver is in another room)
⤷ Jan Steinbach : 
BTW: Audio out only via HDMI ARC would be realy great..
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Jan, around 20 to 30meters, basically like a smartphone. For the moment we don't have ARC cause we need to redesign again the PCBA and now we closed all the topic in order to reach our schedule. Cheers!

Siddhant

David Liew : 
I’m assuming the HDMI 1.4 is ARC compliant? Does that mean if I feed the PicoPix Max through HDMI ARC through a proper AV receiver system it will bypass its own internal speakers and output audio signal e.g. native DTS/Atmos/etc processed by the AV system to our own home theatre speakers?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello David, for the moment we don't have ARC as our PicoPix Max is supposed to be a portable projector. Have a good day!
Will Plaister : 
Hi Philips,
Will there be a menu option to switch off the speaker function? For example, if I have the sound through my home theater system, I will not need 2x4w speakers playing simultaneously.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Will, 
If you pair your home theatre system through Bluetooth, the sound will be forwarded to your system. Cheers!
H B : 
Hi, you said you tested the Capsule II in front of your product. You said your product is almost 4 times brighter, which is good. I'd be interested to hear the results of the speakers comparaison? Also, how the fans noise compare? Cheers
⤷ Philips Projection : 
HB, in terms of speakers, as our engine and battery are bigger, our speakers are a little bit less powerful compared to Nebula. On there side, they almost have 70% of the unit for sound, but we decided to get a bigger battery and brighter engine and Full HD DMD. We are currently fine tuning the sound.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
In terms of fan noise, as our engine is 4 times more bright and bigger, the fan will run a bit higher than them.
⤷ H B : 
Hey, thanks for these honest answers. That is what I thought and that's why I since the begining of the campaign I asked if some hardware upgrade on the speakers (to cover fan noise and deliver a proper all-in-one experience) would be possible. Any update on that part? Thanks
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello HB, the fan noise is totally covered by the speakers. Even if we have smaller speakers than some of our competitors, they sound great. No we have no space to implement bigger speakers.
⤷ H B : 
I hope it is covered haha, but I meant at lower volume because sometimes you dont want to push volume at max level. I tried the 5w speaker on the Capsule I and it was pretty much trash, that's why I'm concerned about those 2 x 4w tiny speakers (the Capsule 2 8w speaker is actually good (deep and loud)).
⤷ Philips Projection : 
HB, it's just a question of space. Bigger speaker, bigger power, need bigger space. Adding the same speakers used on the Nebula would increase the size of our projector by at least 4cm high...
⤷ H B : 
Maybe something not as big, but like a middle ground, is there a big difference in terms of space for 5 or 6 watts speakers that would contribute to offer a better experience?
Mike : 
Will there be an Australian power adapter included?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello, yes we are confirming now with our Logistic team to make different SKUs :-)
⤷ Mike : 
Amazing, thanks! Also, will AirPlay will work directly with Apple products or will we need to use an app to enable screen mirroring?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Michael, yes the PicoPix Max supports directly Apple devices iOS, MacOS for Airplay screen mirroring! Cheers
Jens : 
Did u experience the  rainbow-effect with your dlp?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Jens, not at all, very few person sees the rainbow effect and 1 engineer in our company is subject to it. But lucky for us not with our PicoPix Max

Jens : 
For all the backers questioning the lumens/ansi value: it's complicated.

https://www.viewsonic.com/de/products/projectors/lumens/
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Jens, you are totally right. And even 2 projectors taken from the competition, advertising the same lumens, will have a totally different perceived brightness.

What’s the brightness spec in standardized lumens ? 
Thank you
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Gabriel: there is no standard anymore. The 800 Lumens has been calculated by our engineers and also compared to many brands selling their device at 800 Lumens. We also compared some other brand advertising 1000 but our projector had the same brightness.

⤷ Rahul Bandekar : 
Calculation details :
Item cost : 34000

Shipment cost : 0

Insurance cost : 0

CIF value (item cost + shipment cost + insurance cost) : 34000

Customs duty rate : 10%

CUSTOMS DUTY (customs duty rate * (CIF)) : 3400

Vat rate : 18%

VAT (vat rate * (Customs duty+CIF+other taxes if applicable)) : 6732

Total amount to be paid : 50143.2(excluding extra taxes if applicable)

It comes around US 700$
⤷ Rahul Bandekar : 
Product details :
Product description : Projector

Category : Cameras, Audio & Video

Sub Category : Tv-Home-Theatre-Projectors

Item name : Projector

Hs code : 85-28-69-0-0
Extra taxes details :
LANDING CHARGE IS : 340

CEX IS : 1020

COUNTERVAILING DUTY CESS IS : 4420

ADDITIONAL CVD IS : 231.2

CIF Countervailing Duty of 0 or 448.8 applicable on certain goods
⤷ Rahul Bandekar :

⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello There, if you read the entire conversation from the beginning, this topic has been approached several times. We concluded that Android OS is the best solution. It is not a question of money but a question of usability. Also, Android TV requires Netflix full integration which they are not able to support if you don't sell less the 500,000 units of 1 device (PicoPix Max). Also, it requires a special platform, meaning we would need to totally change the PCBA. Thanks and have a great day!

Mathieu jobic : 
In some comment you are talking about the paint you use for a mirror effect, please eon't do that has shiny glossy paint use to show scratch, finger print and other, why not a mat paint ? It would also diminish all the reflection coming on the pico, reflection paint become a bit of a light parasit if you have to much reflection, the paint need to absorb the light not reflecting it
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Mathieu, we chose to have a different approach here, all our PicoPix products get the same treatment. We exactly thought about your comment before choosing this painting and we don't have any issue with this when testing. If you are at IFA Berlin, come to see it! Cheers!
Rahul Bandekar : 
I agree with Jibin333. The colour lumens is very confusing. I already have one smart dlp led android pico projector with 510 Ansi lumens. And contrast ratio is 3000:1. Inbuilt battery life is 2.5 hrs. Infact has all the feature except my projector has native resolution of 1280 x 800. I backed this project looking at the lumens figure. But now I am worried with the colour lumens. If it is going below 600 ansi lumens and not colour lumens then it is not worth for me to buy.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Unfortunately, the rule that ANSI Lumens are a universal measurement of brightness for projectors is simply not the case. ANSI Lumens refers to the measurement of determining the brightness of white pixels and was adapted for lamp based projectors. Current projector technology like LED projectors with RGB-B have better color saturation and appear brighter than lamp based projectors.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
With the evolution of both the content that we watch and the projectors themselves, standard ANSI Lumens are now obsolete. We are using the term Color Lumens which better describes how bright the image will actually look. Essentially, Color Lumens = Lumens + Vivid Color + Fine Tuned Picture Settings.
⤷ Rahul Bandekar : 
I don't understand the concept of colour lumens. I am just expecting that your projector has to be more superior than what I have right now. I am happy with your projector specification only just the confusion was of lumens. I hope this one has the best colour, bright enough and crisp image to watch live sports like football and tennis and play game on xbox one.
⤷ Rahul Bandekar : 
And I also appreciate the way you are answering the questions of your backer. Thanks for that
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Dear Rahul, thanks for the support! You will see it in live soon!

⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hi Ronald! Thanks everyone! Really! 
Concerning the stretch goal, it's a good idea but this project is not only about money. Stretch goal has been defined to say: 50K to make 1 product with A-B specs in Z timeline. Making an extra Goal for C-D specs will increase a lot the timeline and we wouldn't be able to keep the schedule. As we say in French: " The most beautiful woman/man can only give what she/he has". Always going for the best is great but as a global brand, we need to be sure about the
⤷ Philips Projection : 
quality, schedule and delivery. Making a product is not easy, we have a lot of geek in our team pushing for new features every 2 days, we want to make a perfect product but... waiting for the perfect product is like running to find the root of the rainbow! All your inputs are very very impressive and help us a lot. Let's make first this product first!!

Oliver : 
Please relax, people … Devices with LiIon batteries contain circuits that take care of the minimum and maximum charging level. So when you see “100 %”, then it is at the maximum that the circuit deems healthy for that particular battery, NOT the absolute physical maximum you can push into it. So charging to 100 % is fine.

Similarly, when the level is displayed as “0 %” and the device switches off automatically, then the battery is NOT really completely empty either, otherwise it would be dead.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Oliver, you are right, even at zero there is a security. If you don't charge it for 1 year it will go below the security and enter the sleep mode.
Jens : 
Please avoid recharging till 100 percent. Its common knowledge that it aint good for the battery. E. G.: "While you're charging it back up, you should also avoid pushing a lithium-ion battery all the way to 100 percent." (from 
 https://www.popsci.com/charge-batteries-right/)
Tom : 
Hi,

I didn’t find the “distant needed” to reach this size or this size.
Do you have some examples? From 1m?
Thanks! Can’t wait ?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Tom, 126" from the wall gives you 120" for eg! Cheers!

Will Plaister : 
@Aurora Friday- Almost ALL manufacturers use third party components. For example power supply, capacitors, bluetooth/wifi/dac chips. It SHOULDN'T come as a surprise that 'what's under the hood' isn't Philips proprietary components. That would mean that Philips would need factories for all of those components too! TV panels are the same deal: Philips, Sharp, Samsung, Sony, LG, Panasonic, Loewe, Hisense...arguably what's inside these TVs comes from the same supplier.

the xiaomi miija full hd projector has no battery and only chinese app-store
the quimi q8 is brighter, but more expensive, has a battery but is not smart
the quimi q38 is worse in all terms

Mathieu jobic : 
About the internal memory of 16gb, i'm kind of thinking it's not enough, to many app required lot of space and you can't move them around, youshould check how much space take the os with stuff like netflix,amazon video,vlc,powerpoint, and other because i am feeling it will be full and we won't have enough space for update, i would be better with a 32gb, because nowaday no one in their right mind would get 16gb phone
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Mathieu, we understand your concerns. Having made a survey over 1000 customers, we found out that 16Gb was enough. 1: the cost of the memory is quite expensive 2: In Europe, there is a law about the personal copy Vs Storage: the more you have storage, the highest is the fee. Our Customers didn't want to pay extra especially that we have a microSD card able to reach 512Gb and can integrate with Android as a core storage. Cheers!

Aurora Friday : 
Hi Phlips, saw what Rupert Holden asking about CPU/GPU and i did a google and found http://opensource.rock-chips.com/wiki_RK3328 , https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rockchip  . its seems like most of the features Philips PicoPix Max belongs to this china chip maker.  May we ask which technology does philip own in this baby?
⤷ Philips Projection :

I'm not sure to understand the question.
⤷ Aurora Friday : 
Rupert Holden 5 days ago
Hi, can you tell me what CPU/GPU this will have?

Philips Projection 5 days ago
PROJECT OWNER
Hello Rupert! we are using an RK3328. Have a nice day!
⤷ Aurora Friday : 
Overview: RK3328 belonging to China Chip maker Rockchip , offers a high-integration and power efficiency SOC for 4K HDR OTT/IPTV. It support HDR10 ,HLG HDR , 4K 10bits 30fps H.264 video decoder and 4K 10bits 60fps H265 video decoder.Comply with lots of high-performance interface,such as multi-channel display with HDMI2.0a, TV Encoder, the Quad-core GPU can acheive high-resolution display and game.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Aurora, yes exactly.

Sebastian : 
Hi there,

please consider using a Bluetooth chip with aptx low latency support! All other Bluetooth audio codecs have latency which is too high for lip-sync critical or action video content. 

https://www.aptx.com/aptx-low-latency

Best regards
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Sebastien, thanks for your input! there is no need for aptX chip. We are working on the audio latency directly on the BT libraries. Have a great day!
⤷ Sebastian : 
Here is a comparison of Bluetooth codec latencies for flagship android phones: https://www.soundguys.com/android-bluetooth-latency-22732/

The best you can get is apparently still over 200ms without aptx low latency which is simply not acceptable for video content. I can understand that it is not possible to include an aptx low latency chip at this price point but please take it into consideration.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Sebastien, we have already implemented the BT5 and we cannot anymore change the PCBA at this stage. This will delay again the project and add costs. We are working on the software side :-) Thanks!
Andrej Mioc : 
Hi Phillips,

What is the max distance between the projector and the screen to keep a perfect detailed view?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Andrej, 126" max!
Regards
Karl : 
How often will you send out important security fixes for the stock software (i.e ASAP, once a month etc)?
Some vendors simply ignore fixing security vulnerabilities and leave the product insecure for a very long time or at worst, forever.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Dear Karl, we understand your concern. However, a projector is not a mobile phone and less likely to be targeted by malware. The number of application per projector is likely to be around 10 where smartphones can count around 150. Our users won't pay with it nor check their email directly within the projector. That's said, the PicoPix Max is already very secured ad we will do some patches but not every months. Have a great day!
⤷ Karl : 
This projector might not be a mobile phone but a mobile device which will be exposed to many hostile environments. Just like fridges (usually you dont check mail and pay with this one either) and other IOT things that gets hacked and for instance, becoming a member of a criminal botnet due to low security standards. It doesn't really matter if your device is secure right now, since that could change tomorrow. I hope you take your responsibility and focus on keeping your customers secure.

Hi can I get an invoice. I backed this project and will use it fir my company. Please let me know.

Hello, could you please send us an email so we can keep your contact? Thanks
⤷ info : 
To what email address
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello@picopix.com
Max : 
Why is it limited to 120”?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Max, it is limited to 120" because we want our user to get the best experience in terms of brightness and colors. You can increase to 150% but don't suggest it as you we loose the experience we intended to have with the PicoPix Max

Duncan L : 
Hey there! Really excited to back this project.

I have observed that you have selected Aptoide store for app downloading. Will Google Play Store be loaded as well? If not, any specific reasons why? Thanks!
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Duncan, We won't install the Google Playstore because of some reasons:
- Google doesn't certify projectors
- Google Playstore gather apps that are not made for landscape mode
Have a good day!
⤷ Duncan L : 
Many thanks for the prompt response.

⤷ Philips Projection :

tobias.klaus :

⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Tobias, 
Yes but it needs to be powerful enough.
Thanks!
⤷ tobias.klaus : 
what do you mean by powerful enough? amphours is usually what diffentiates the market there, voltage is the same ... so you need 5500mAh to run it for 1 hour? - or is there anything else to consider?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Tobias, your powerbank will charge the internal battery while the internal battery will gives the power to the PicoPix Max. You will need 45watts.

3 questions.

1: 320cm around
2: there is not loss putting it near to the wall or using the digital zoom
3: yes exactly, 600 more!

Unfortunately not! the autofocus will help you to always be focused but 120" is already really big. 3meters from the wall is easy to measure :-)

bd_tigers : 
My bed frame (where I would put the projector) is 120" away from the wall but based on my wall's width, I can only project a 74" diagonal screen (at 16:9). So I will have to be using the digital zoom feature extensively. Would this (projecting from 120" but zooming it down to a 74" screen) be possible? Will the digital zoom cause any loss of quality such as a reduction in focus/sharpness, color vibrance or brightness? Secondly, is the 4 point keystone feature still usable after digital zoom?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hi there!
Yes it will be possible thanks to the digital zoom and won't cause any loss. The 4 point correction will still be usable after you have customized the digital zoom. However, we suggest to always place the projector in the best condition for the best viewing experience. Cheers!
⤷ bd_tigers : 
Great, thanks so much for the quick reply!
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Welcome!
Methee Kriengparinyakij : 
What fast charging technology does PicoPix Max support on its USB-C port (e.g. Power Delivery, Quick Charge 3.0, etc)? What is the power input requirements on this port? Thank your very much.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Methee, QC fast charging is only for Qualcomm based CPUs, you will need around 45watts so you can use for eg your MacBook Pro charger to power it. USB-C is smart and our PicoPix Max will ask the charger to deliver the right power to it. Thanks!

⤷ William Steele : 
As reading on some of these S series projectors it seems Screeneo SA leans on the now Chinese projector market leaders for technical expertise.

There is nothing inherently wrong with partnerships in tech, they happen all the time (as well as white labelling) and I’m sure this will be a great projector but would be good to know if this is a 100% ground-up product from Philips Projection or for use of a better way of putting it, a variant version of a JmGO/other also in-development product.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello William, the PicoPix Max and other models in our Collections are produced in partnership with the best projector manufacturers in China and Taiwan. Our PicoPix Max has been designed from scratch, following the design language of our PicoPix Collection (Nano and Micro for eg.) Have a great day!

Cronan Lavelle : 
Hi I had asked a question about sonos compatibly. I’d like to know if you can offer a solution of how to get this working with a sonos beam plugged in near the screen. This would be wirelessly connected to two sonos play 1’s for surround sound. Then I would have an Apple TV 3 either plugged into the sonos beam or the projector on the other side of the room. How would you suggest I get surround sound working without any sound lag with this Pico projector? Can you let me know what kit would help?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Cronan, if I were you: connect the Apple TV to our PicoPix Max via HDMI, connect the sonos beam via optical to your Apple TV, tell your Apple TV to drive the sound to optical out. and voila! regards,
⤷ Cronan Lavelle : 
Thanks. I’ll look into what that involves
⤷ Cronan Lavelle : 
How would I do what you said? Apple TV only has one HDMI out port. So how do I connect a sonos beam to it via optical when the Apple TV is connected to the PICOPIX already? Preferably I’d like very few or no wires across the room and the projector would be 10-12 feet back from the beam. Do I need to get some kind of splitters to get a HDMI out to turn into a HDMI and Optical out? Then wire up 10 feet across the room with the optical out to plug sound into the sonos beam from the Apple TV?
⤷ Cronan Lavelle : 
Just to be clear. There is no optical out on the back of the Apple TV. my one anyway
⤷ Cronan Lavelle : 
Sorry. Think my Apple TV is actually the 4th generation but not 4K. There is no optical out on it either way
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Cronan, so they other way is to plug your Apple TV to an AV receiver with 2 HDMI. So the AV takes the sound and send back the picture to the PicoPix max

⤷ Tony Petrilli : 
The reason for asking about the chipset is due to what has happened on another IGG campaign for the PIQO Projector where the campaigner claimed specific capabilities and specific components. 

Only for early backers to receive it, disassemble the device, and discover that  both the capabilities and components were far less than claimed.
⤷ Tony Petrilli : 
Getting chipset info for your projector would go a long way to ensuring that backers are getting what is claimed.

Some of your backers are likely to back out before the campaign deadline without such info in order to avod the disaster that the PIQO campaign has become.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Tony, with regards to Piqo; they are "competitors" and we will not comment. We only find strange that the same product is published very often in different platforms under different names and no one has ever received a real product. Philips is  market leaders in projectors (based on GfK figures) and with the new range we are bringing the best of technology available today to provide a great projector experience. We won't full you on the resolution like other did. Y
⤷ Philips Projection : 
you can be assured that the DMD we are using is full HD!

Floriaan Mekes : 
I participated in the campaign a few days ago because I thought I would miss out on the limited stock. Now I see you keep refilling the stocks before it runs empty. Isn't this just an early unlimited sale? And whats the point of mentioning the "Only *number* left".
⤷ Philips Projection : 
We've always had a particular number of units earmarked for lower price tiers. Because Philips is a worldwide company, based off of the geos we're driving to the page via various email placements, we will add to this number based on our projections. It's only fair that we keep these prices to ensure that our waitlist subscribers in those geos have access. However, one shouldn't assume that these will last forever. Backing now is the only way to lock in the lowest price.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Our next tier will not only have a higher price, but will also not not include free shipping.

Yavar Reghabi : 
hello there, few things i wanted to clarify:

1. does the projector work if it is plugged into to a power source? is this feature something that you could add if possible ?
2. can you extended the battery life via connecting a battery bank ?
3. does it project 4K resolution ?
4. does it project well and clear in a bright room with a white background ?

Thank you for your feedback.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Yavar
1: yes for, it works on battery and/or when plugged in
2: yes, the powerbank will charge the battery 
3: no, it project Full HD 1080p, but accepts 4K input
4: The Philips PicoPix Max is made for use both indoor and outdoor. For the best results, a dimmed space is best. However, it’s bright enough that it will work well even in lit indoor spaces without direct light on the projection surface. For the most optimal use it is recommended you use PicoPix Max in an area with dim to low
Tomislav Subjak : 
It's a concern to read that once the battery loses its power, that connecting to a power outlet does not override. This projector is perfect for my tiny apartment in Tokyo. It won't be in portable transit all the time. I need to vouch for having a product that can be portable but when plugged in to a power outlet - that becomes the main source of power to run the thing. Just my old laptop. Its battery is useless but once plugged in, it can still do the job!
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Tomislav, just to be clear:
1: the PicoPix Max runs on Battery
2: When the battery is empty, you can plug the projector to charge the battery and also use the projector at the same time
3: When the battery is fully charged, we need to check with our R&D if the adapter is still charging it or bypassing it
Hope this is clear :-)
⤷ Tomislav Subjak : 
Thanks for the reply, and I saw the power bypass update in the posts above mine. Cheers to the team for addressing concerns!

⤷ Jan Steinbach : 
Hi again!

the Samsung TV (Remote) f.e. can definitely control the FireTV using HDMI-CEC protocol :-) Using it all the time when I visit my father in law!

Another Idea: The current FireTV Remote has Volume Rockers and an Power Off/On Button to pair with other Devices via Infrared. You Just need to make sure that your Philips specific Infrared Codes are known by the FireTV Operation System (A lot Philips TVs are already supported) ;-)

Jan, it' also a question of CEC control inside the system. For the moment we are considering it but we have already some new features we are working on. This is a lower priority for us but we keep this suggestion on our mind! Thanks again!

Theo Naidoo : 
Everyone asking about this being ‘a gift’ should realise this is a well tested area of law. HMRC (other countries have their equivalent) says in its crowdfunding guidance “Where a contributor receives goods or services that have an intrinsic value (e.g. clothing, tickets, dvd) in exchange for support given, there is a supply for VAT purposes. The VAT treatment will follow the liability of the goods or services provided.” 

Tax avoidance isn’t that easy!

⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Chomosuke. The PicoPix Max is supposed to be a portable device and not connected all the time to a charger. Our R&D team will look into it in any case! thanks!

michaelketigian : 
1) How much does it weigh?

2: Airplay and Miracast work very well without any problem. The PicoPix Max as also Youtube and Netflix already installed so you don't need to use Miracast or Airplay!

⤷ michaelketigian : 
Being able to use Google Assistant to initiate videos with voice is a MAJOR feature. I have the Nebula Capsule II, and this can be achieved through the Assistant-enabled remote, or through a phone, since it has Google Cast. 

Considering Philips has been around much longer and probably has deeper resources, I'd be very surprised to hear that Google wouldn't support this device, especially given that Anker was able to get certification.
⤷ michaelketigian : 
Also —  I've had very poor results with streaming video over Airplay and Miracast. It requires quite a snappy WiFi network, and given the portable element here, it's very hard to have that guaranteed. Google Cast would make this a go for me — the rest of the features are excellent, very much including horizontal keystone.

Thanks for sharing the weight. I had searched with cmd+f, but it's listed within an image.
⤷ michaelketigian : 
Last question, regarding Lumen count — Nebula Capsule lists 200 ANSI lumens. I saw a prior response that didn't really address the commenter's question about brightness. ⤷ Philips Projection :

⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Michael, thanks for your input, the DMD and Light engine as nothing to do with them so we cannot really compare. We are discussing with another brand doing those kind of assistant but it's too early to talk about it :-) Hope you gonna like our Max!
Eric Lerouge : 
If I'm using the Pico plugged a lot of time, will the battery life decreased ? Thanks
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Eric, like all devices with battery (like smartphone or laptops for eg), if you keep the good 100% of the time plugged, yes it may decrease the life of the battery. We suggest to always drain the battery till 0 and charge it at 100% at least once a month. Cheers!

Brice Gonzalvez :

What is the contrast ratio of this projector?  This is often the major flaw of projectors of this type.

⤷ Philips Projection :

Lorenzo Monachini : 
Can you please clarify the Lumens?
ANSI Color Lumens doesn't exist. It exist ANSI lumens and Color Light Output. The CLO method is similar to ANSI, but instead of using a 100% white test pattern, one uses red, green and blue test patterns instead. Separate meter readings are taken for red, green, and blue, then added together. It means that if 800 is the sum it's something between 250 to 300 ANSI Lumens. I thought Philips was an honest company.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Dear Lorenzo, thanks for your question. We understand your concern. Unfortunately, the rule that ANSI Lumens are a universal measurement of brightness for projectors is simply not the case. ANSI Lumens refers to the measurement of determining the brightness of white pixels and was adapted for lamp based projectors. Current projector technology like LED projectors with RGB-B have better color saturation and appear brighter than lamp based projectors.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
With the evolution of both the content that we watch and the projectors themselves, standard ANSI Lumens are now obsolete. The reality is that is you take 2 projectors from 2 different brands with the same advertised ANSI lumens, you will see a very big difference. We are using the term Color Lumens which better describes how bright the image will actually look. Essentially, Color Lumens = Lumens + Vivid Color + Fine Tuned Picture Settings.
⤷ Lorenzo Monachini : 
You explained what is Color Lumens, but I can't understand what is ANSI Color Lumens. ANSI is a thing and Color Lumens seems to be very different. I'm agree that nowaday with Led projector ANSI is not accurate, but it is a standard measurement, here you're inventing something else so you can't write ANSI if it doesn't respect the ANSI measurement.
Elaine Lam : 
Hi, my contribution id is 3772, am i 100% receiving the product on October? Thanks
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello There! yes for sure! 100%. Have a great day!
Jan Steinbach :

(I think Audiosignal pushing to proprietary SONOS Speaker Protocol, not Bluetooth)
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Jan, it's a good question and we've talked about it internally, unfortunately we don't support this feature for the moment. We will dig into it and see the effort. On the other hand, apps like Plex can support Sonos audio.
Jens :

" (http://www.aftvnews.com/amazon-fire-tv-gains-automatic-video-frame-rate-matching-with-latest-software-update/)

The Services do not include the offer or sale of securities (as such term is defined in the Securities Act of 1933), and Indiegogo, Inc. is not a broker-dealer or a member of the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority."

LEGRET Nicolas : 
"This project is to be the very first to buy a product at very aggressive conditions."
You're wrong, and I don't care what your lawyers say.
You choosed indiegogo as a partner, well maybe you should understand how indiegogo and crowdfunding in general works :
https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles/206389847-What-is-Crowdfunding
⤷ LEGRET Nicolas : 
It is important to understand that backing a campaign and claiming a perk are not the same as buying an item online. Instead, supporting a crowdfunding idea on a platform like Indiegogo means you are helping a work-in-progress project, idea or cause.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
We regret not to be able to satisfy you in spite of our efforts to give you answers. We respect your opinion even if we disagree with your statement.

Jens : 
Regarding the 60 Hz/MEMC-topic: So this is going to be a software-solution which might be an odd solution if not done right, with artifical-looking and blurry images?!? Is there no way to display the movies/games with their native resolution on a hardware-basis?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Jens, there are some ways to do it, but not in a such tiny product and with this cost. We have tested many videos and gaming, 60Hz is not an issue at hall. Let's take another example, on your TV, everything is at 60Hz, 100, 120 or even 200hz sometimes. All your movies or gaming are refreshed at those rates. Another eg: Netflix Movie are often in 4K 60hz.

LEGRET Nicolas : 
Hi team, since many answers are avoided, let me ask again :
1- do you agree to refund if your forwarder wants to charge more than VAT, as it happens when they need to handle taxes ?
2- Which refresh rates are being natively displayed (50Hz, 60Hz, 23.976Hz, 24Hz, 25Hz)?
3- VAT only applies to purchased items. We are contributing money towards the completion of your project and you provide us samples in return.
Why should we pay VAT ?
Please answer questions, stop turning them around..
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Bonjour Nicolas!
As a backer, you are contributing towards a project. This project is to be the very first to buy a product at very aggressive conditions. We asked several time our legal team and their answer is quite clear: each backer will receive a product against his contribution to the project. So in fact, according to local laws in US and Europe, you are indirectly buying a product, and therefore, you have to pay the VAT.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Sorry, we are not making Laws, and we pay a lot of attention to respect them. And we hope you share the same point of view.
⤷ LEGRET Nicolas : 
I do. I don't make laws either, but I know how to read and understand them.
Perks offered (=gifts) are NOT subjected to VAT in my country !

Also, in my country, when we buy something online, we are eligible BY LAW to consumer warranties, which do not exist when contributing to indiegogo's projects.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello, the PicoPix Max has 24 months warranty. Wish you a sunny day in South of France!
⤷ LEGRET Nicolas : 
Yes, that's what you say, as others do on this site.
But reality is, nothing can enforce you to act once the "sale" is made, thus you don't respect the law, with the help of your "partner" indiegogo.

Pablo Perla : 
Again about the VAT and the legalese behind it.
As per crowdfunding definition, we are not purchasing items, we are contributing money towards the completion of a project and the owner of that project graciously decides to provide us samples in return.
Technically, this is not a sale and that is why crowdfunding is such a dangerous business for backers.
In such scenario, do VAT apply?, it has not been a sale of a product.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Pablo, yes, after checking with Indiegogo and our lawyer, the collection of VAT cannot apply on something that is not shipping yet. That's why the VAT collection apply after shipping on your side and in you country. The VAT does apply because we are sending a good. Hope we answered your question! Have a great day
⤷ Pablo Perla : 
Crystal clear, thank you for your answer!
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Welcome Pablo!

⤷ Tony Petrilli : 
Also, I strongly recommend that if shipping from the U.S. to Canada that you use express shipping from the U.S. Postal Service, as DHL and UPS have incredibly high "brokerage" fees for bringing a Duty item across the border. FedEx is ever so slightly better, but also quite high. So please, if this is the case,  use the US Post.

Jan Steinbach : 
How high is the projection offset when f.e. placing the PicoPix on an table? Will the projection start at the same position as the Lens or Higher?

I'm trying to calculate where my Picture Start when placing the device on an specific existing table ;)
⤷ Jan Steinbach : 
Ah it seems that the projection is straight and directly Beginns at the height position of the DLP-"Lamp"

https://c3.iggcdn.com/indiegogo-media-prod-cld/image/upload/c_fill,w_695,g_auto,q_auto,dpr_1.7,f_auto,h_460/scvtrzntwqe6tibwekio
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Jan, yes exactly! This is what we call 100% offset. the image start straight forward from the projector and goes up. The image does't go down if you place it on a table.

⤷ Philips Projection : 
Cronan, if you have an Apple TV, you can connect it via HDMI to the PicoPix Max, and wire the optical out of your Apple TV to Sonos. Then within the Apple TV interface, you can forward the sound to optical out. Wish you a nice day

Maikel Bennebroek : 
I was wondering how the keystone correction works. Is this also automated?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hey Maikel! The auto keystone works for the horizontal correction. Then you can use the 4 corners corrections to adjust each corners. Let's say you have your projector 15 degrees from the wall, you can still have a straight image. Cheers!

Junhyeok Jeon : 
Can I connect nintendo switch without dock?
(with usb c cable)
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Junhyeok, 
You can connect your Switch to the USB-C video port on our PicoPix Max, but you will need to connect your switch to a power adapter otherwise your console won't be able to screen mirror anything.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
You will need the cradle in any case because USB-C is not a video standard, it is a connection standard. The Switch outputs video as DisplayPort over the USB-C connection. The dock then converts the DisplayPort video into HDMI video. That video then leaves the dock and goes into your TV via the HDMI output connection. Better use the HDMI on your cradle
Arianna Sala : 
I'm really thrilled about this projector. Like many before me, I'm also interested in  Bluetooth 5.0 to connect 2 devices. Stronger speakers are not interesting to me, as I'm planning to connect it to portable speakers.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hey Arianna! Thanks for your support! Yes are now digging into BT5 and will give all of you an answer withing next week.
⤷ Arianna Sala : 
Thanks for the reply!  :)
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Welcome Arianna!

Jens : 
Am I right that if I connect my ps4 via hdmi to the PicoPix and connect the ps4 via optout to my av-receiver, I get surroundsound AND 120"-images? :) Same for every other device like dedicated blu-ray-players, xbox one etc?!?
⤷ Jens : 
And another question: If Im watching Netflix or Amazon Video on my Android 9-device in the particular app via my mobile plan: Is it possible to "push" the image to the PicoPix via the Android-"Play on"-function?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Jens!
1: yes you will be able to get the image on our projector and the sound on your AV receiver, but only if you have optical out on your PS4 or BR player
2: No you cannot push the content from Netflix on your phone to the projector because they blocked this feature some months ago. Youtube is working for sure. In any case, Netflix is already installed in our device and you can simply add you account there!. Easy right?
⤷ Jens : 
mmmhm ok. Its a bit a pity ,cos there's no wifi in our garden. So that would have been very conveniant if I could have used simply my mobile plan where video's included ^^ but well. Not your fault :)
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Jens, yes you are right, it's a question of security in the stream. My 2 cents: just a 69 USD Wi-Fi extender in your garden and you will be able to watch movies without draining your plan!
⤷ Jens : 
Theoretically yes, practically no, the garden's not close to our house :)
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Other solution for you: activate the hotspot mode on your phone so you the PicoPix Max can connect directly to it!

Andres Olguin : 
What are the audio outputs? And more specifically, will the usb (or usb-c) port bitstream audio? I would like to connect the PicoPix to either a Creative Super X-Fi amp or an Audeze Mobius headset for 5.1 surround in Netflix for example.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
hello Andres, 
Our PicoPix Max is considered as a portable device and can be also connected to an extra speaker via Bluetooth. For the moment, our PicoPix Max is not able to connect to 5.1 or 7.1 surround system. The other solution is to plug an external smart box like an Apple TV for eg, forward the image to the projector, and the audio to your surround system. Wish you a great day!

Theo Naidoo : 
Hi, great looking project! I’m curious about whether it will work with an Apple TV that’s directly connected to speakers? Because even if it’s made for portability it’s a great solution for those of us in small flats. Best of luck.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Theo, 
Yes, you can connect the Apple TV via HDMI to our PicoPix Max. You speakers must be connected to you Apple TV as well. Then you can forward the sound to optical directly in you Apple TV (OPTICAL OUT menu). Have a great day!
⤷ Theo Naidoo : 
Thanks so much for the quick reply. Your graphics say that this will work with airplay, (which is how I would prefer to connect to the Apple TV). When you give an update I’m interested in hearing more about how this works- as as I’m not aware of any other android devices which can do that?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Theo! You are welcome.
Your iOS devices, MacOS devices can simply use the Airplay system to throw image and videos directly to our projector (Screen Mirroring). But you cannot connect your Apple TV to our PicoPix Max via Airplay because they are both receivers. Better to connect it via HDMI! Have a great day
Chomusuke : 
I don't know if it can be used, but there are such batteries
https://www.amazon.co.jp/dp/B07D4F9JJN/
Oliver : 
Can you confirm that the device can be operated from a portable power bank? According to the specs you'll need a 45 W power supply (please correct me if I'm wrong). There are no portable power banks with that much power output. I've got a quite expensive one from Anker (20,000 mAh) and it has 15 W output. My smaller one provides only 10 W even (5V 2A per port), but these type of power banks are very common.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Oliver, the powerbank will charge the internal battery of our PicoPix Max. If you want to operate the projector with a drained battery, you'll need a bigger powerbank to deliver enough power.
Chomusuke : 
@Oliver 
Improved speakers and Bluetooth 5.0 support are the features everyone wants. I don't think the battery will be affected by Bluetooth 5.0. If you are worried about the battery, please connect the mobile battery.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hi Guys, yes this is a cool feature are we are now discussing internally about this. We will keep you posted as soon as we have more intel! Have a great day!
Oliver : 
Please do NOT include stronger speakers IF that means making the device larger or reducing battery life. After all, this is supposed to be a portable unit, and I plan to connect it to a portable BlueTooth speaker anyway (JBL Charge 3), so I don't need the built-in speakers at all. And I don't think you'll be able to compete with the sound quality of an external speaker anyway.
⤷ Oliver : 
Also, if supporting BlueTooth 5 means incorporating a separate chip (separate from the WLAN chip, I mean), thus taking more power, thus reducing battery life – then please refrain from doing that. This is a portable device, so you have to try to find some middle-ground. You can't make a do-everything gadget. Size and battery life are KEY factors for a portable device. I'd rather like to have longer battery life so you can watch “Titanic” or “Lord of the Rings” with one charge.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hi Oliver, you are right but we are now checking for a Dual Mode Module Wi-Fi + BT 5.

5: For the cable, as we are talking about a portable device, we need to maximize the power length and the fact that is needs to be portable. The average size for a portable device is around 1.2 meter (used on laptops, smartphones...)

Nena :

⤷ Philips Projection :

H B : 
I am sure you'll make a great software and sell 500K/year with good speakers ;)
"Concerning the sound, we are working on it" meaning you might consider an upgrade on the speakers?

Speakers are important, as I said an all in one solution require good speakers. Also, will you be able to use it only as an external bluetooth speaker without projection? The Capsule II can do that too and it is quite usefull.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello HB, Very good sound means space. The speaker room (the box where is the speaker) is as much important as the speaker used, as well as the tuning made for them. in the case of the Capsule, they used a very big space for the speakers, but they sacrifice the brightness, battery and resolution. For sure we need to get the best sound as possible, but we cannot increase the size of our product, nor decrease other specifications. We are looking at a solutions for speakers and BT5.
⤷ H B : 
Great news! As I asked before, will I be able to use the PP Max as a bluetooth speaker to stream music from an external device? Again, what people also like with the Capsule is that they dont need to buy/bring an external bluetooth speaker. It is a portable/travel projector so it has to be versatile.

Plenty of more powerfull, cheaper (and little bigger) projectors are already on the market if you mostly want to leave it at home and pair it with speakers.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello HB, for the moment we don't support this feature but we will dig into it with our R&D!
mcfly11056 : 
I'm super excited that you guys are using Indiegogo platform to get backers' feedbacks. Since you guys have exceeded your goal by over 1800%, will the exceeded amount goes to upgrades or changes to the PicoPix Max?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
HI There, 
Any upgrade or new features new to be carefully considered. Cost for the components, schedule to develop it, test, new proto... Adding a new feature is not so easy and our team constantly try to balance new features and delivery time line. A new feature or enhancement can impact all aspect ans that's why need to get an holistic view on the situation before moving
⤷ mcfly11056 : 
I understand that your plan is to release the finish product in a couple of months.  Been a backer for other projects but they usually have a longer time frame for backers' support so they could make minor adjustments or small tweaks if possible. This will replace my Nebula Capsule 2!
⤷ Philips Projection :

Jann Gerrit : 
Hi very friendly and responsive PicoPix team in Switzerland - I am excited to soon get this compact/sized yet mighty projector. The features look really great .... just that you wanna go with a outdated Bluetooth standard below 5.0 is something that I do not understand. Can’t you tell your product managers and the R&D team that this detail is hard to sell?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Jann, seeing the great campaign we have now, I don't think that this is a big issue :-).
Nevertheless, we are now trying to work on it. The issue is that today we use a Wifi+BT module, all in one. If we want to use BT 5, we need an extra BT Module just for the 5 and we need to redesign the PCBA, we are currently anlysing the situation in terms of timing, test and feasability. Alos cot for sure... Thanks for your support!
⤷ Jann Gerrit : 
It is a nice package anyway. But if you have the chance of making the device even a bit more future-proof and capable in the field of wireless connectivity you are goung to make my Sunday:) 
By the way: Are you sure an extra module is needed just for Bluetooth 5.0? It seems to me that a combination of WiFi plus 5.0 is not that exotic anymore. 
https://eu.industrial.panasonic.com/products/wireless-connectivity/bluetooth-wi-fi-combo/bluetooth-wi-fi-combo-products/series/pan9026/CS2943/model/ENWF
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Jann, yes there are existing solution, at a cost... We are digging into it.

H B : 
Hi, just wondering if 2x 4w speakers would not be too weak for a travel projector. I mean a great quality picture with tiny sound would make an external bluetooth speaker essential and kill the whole purpose of an all-in-one travel projector solution. Just some thoughts.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello HB.
IN order to maximise the size of the product, we need to keep the speakers as small as possible but the power delivered is enough. For example the bluetooth speaker JBL Clip 3 is only 1x3watts and made for outdoor!
⤷ H B : 
Yes but the capsule I has a 5w speaker and it is actually really weak. The Capsule II I own has 8w and it's much better (deep and loud). I don't want to feel a sound downgrade switching to the PP Max and that is probably the only thing Capsule II has over the PP Max (and Android TV OS maybe).
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hi HB, the Capsule 2 is only HD 720P, our PicoPix Max is Full HD 1080p, this is one of the biggest difference on the capsule, there are many other features that are no in the Capsule and I can detail them if you want to. You wont regret moving to the PicoPix Max!
⤷ H B : 
Yes thats why i said your speakers and maybe the OS are the only downsides in comparaison with the Capsule 2. The Capsule 2 has an 8w speaker with a very good sound and Im not sure 2x 4w can match that. It would be too bad to have a better picture but a worst sound than your only direct competitor. 

Android TV OS is very good too.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
hello HB, it really depends on the consumer target, a lot of our consumers prefer to get Android OS rather than Android TV. You can get Android TV quiet easily but you wont be able to get Neftlix on Android TV because they require very big volume on the same device (around 500K unit per year). That's why we chose Android OS for the moment. Concerning the sound, we are working on it :-)
⤷ H B : 
I am sure you’ll make a great software and sell 500K/year with good speakers ;)
“Concerning the sound, we are working on it” meaning you might consider an upgrade on the speakers?

Speakers are important, as I said an all in one solution require good speakers. Also, will you be able to use it only as an external bluetooth speaker without projection? The Capsule II can do that too and it is quite usefull.

(sorry for double post)
Ivan Fung : 
Can you provide some kind of reference point to the 800 Color Lumens you described? Like a comparable product, or in terms of ANSI, or how is the viewing experience in a brightly lit room?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Ivan.
The Philips PicoPix Max is made for use both indoor and outdoor. For the best results, a dimmed space is best. However, it’s bright enough that it will work well even in lit indoor spaces without direct light on the projection surface. For the most optimal use it is recommended you use PicoPix Max in an area with dim to low ambient lighting.

As a worldwide leader in electronics, we are perhaps a bit more equipped to be successful than most crowdfunding campaigns. We are fully on track to meet our October ship date and look forward to delivering a new world filled with portable, smart, and BIG entertainment.

Lok Tsang : 
Hello, just a few questions regarding the product.
1. What wattage is the charger?
2. How long is the charging cable? Can I use it as a video cable?
3. Does the USB-C video port support power delivery? If yes, what wattage is it?
4. Why the HDMI version is 1.4 not 2.0?
5. Will this product receive any Android/app updates in the future?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Lok!
- We will come back to all of you asking for this as soon as possible
- the charging cable will be between 1 and 1.2m and can also be used as video cable
- the USB-C video port doesn't support charging
- HDMI: current design is using a specially CPU supporting only 1.4 but our R&D is working to swape to the new platform to get 2.0. We will inform you if this is the case
- Yes we will update the product from time to time with new features
Jérémy Faivre :

Pierre Rouchon : 
My external audio speaker is AirPlay only with no Bluetooth.
Is it possible to broadcast sound out of the PicoPix Max via AirPlay and without Bluetooth ?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Pierre, 
No it's not, Android cannot cast to Airplay, like a Samsung smartphone cannot stream to your Airplay speaker.
Ticanaus : 
Hi, just wondering if 800 Ansi colour = 800/3 = 267 Ansi ?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Ticanaus.
Our engineers have found that the term ANSI Lumens can vary from manufacturer to manufacturer, as the term generally refers to outdated technology and has yet to be updated to describe the performance of a projector when rendering full color imagery. We are using the term Color Lumens as defined by our engineers to measure the real number of lumens based on the color/brightness/gamma adjustment settings we have defined in our lab. Essentially, Color Lumens = Lumens + Vivid Color
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Another information: ANSI system was made in the 90s where LED DMD didn't exist so the way to measure Lumens changed.
Jan Steinbach : 
"Contribution ID 1623 | Contribution Date
August 22, 2019"

At that moment there was a message that aprox 650 of max 750 perks where already sold"

⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Tomislav, 
No because this is not a LCD based projector but TI DMD, which is totally sharp on all corners
⤷ Tomislav Subjak : 
Sweet! Just did a bit of research on DMD and wow.. did I choose the right time to jump on the projector bandwagon!
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Tomislav, the pico projector market is really booming since 1 or 2 years now. It's not becoming a massive industry!
Thomas chan :

⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Thomas, 
Min: 30" and HDR 10
Thomas chan : 
What is the output of internal speakers?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Thomas, 2x4watts

⤷ Philips Projection : 
Johan, no, this is jack only.
We are talking here about a portable projector.
⤷ Johan Smedberg :

⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Johan, no but you will be able to connect a Microphone via BT.

Johan Smedberg : 
Is there a possibility to have a manual (override) settings mode of auto keystone and others to be able to do support it? ” we are supporting ceiling and rear projection but not vertical 90 degrees”
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Johan, 
Very few customers want to get this vertical feature and our R&D suggests that we concentrate on more important tunings, enhancements and testings. Nevertheless, the 4 corners correction is manual.

⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Michael, 
Yes indeed, BT 5 is required to have the Dual Audio features. We are digging on this topic with our R&D Team.

The minimum distance is 1meter.

Ivan Loh : 
For such a small device, how loud will the cooling fan be? Previous experiences with small projectors are they all come with really loud fans!
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Ivan
PicoPix Max has a very quiet internal fan. For 10 years, our engineers have been continuously improving our projectors to reduce fan noise. We’re very happy with how quiet our new line of projectors are, and we know you will be to.
marvelous.islander : 
I've read some questions about European VAT. Something still unclear:
1. You won't pay VAT for the product even if you ship within Europe. Backers should be responsible for the additional VAT themselves, am I right?
2. If it is not related to VAT, why there is a price difference? I paid 419 euros instead of 399 euros.
3. Would you declare the full product price or the discounted price to the customs? If full price, it means I need to pay 50% EXTRA as VAT. Declaring as GIFT won't help in Sweden.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello !
1: Yes, always
2: because the super early birds deal is over
3: This is something we are checking with our Logistic team
2:
⤷ marvelous.islander : 
Thank you! Paying a 50% extra as VAT would be totally unworthy, I would have to cancel the perk in that case. Please let me know when you get the answer :)
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello, depending on where you arem the VAT is not greater than 25% like in Island: 24%
⤷ marvelous.islander : 
It seems you did not fully understand me. First of all, I am in Sweden, the VAT rate is 25%. However, how much I need to pay additionally depends on how much you declare the price to the customs. If you declare the full price, then I need to pay 25% percent of the full price as VAT; which is 50% of the current price as VAT. That would be totally out of rational price range. So pls let me know how you are gonna declare the price when shipping.
⤷ marvelous.islander : 
Hi! Do you have an answer to my question already?

⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello there!
Yes for sure!
James Childress : 
What kind of color wheel will this use and are you working to minimize the infamous "rainbow effect" that DLPs are known for? I have been able to see this effect in other DLP mini/pico projectors or at least am able to detect the mirror shift(looks like pixelation/shimmer) when I move my eyes around the projected image. I have read that using more colors or spinning the wheel faster can help minimize this effect.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
James, 
You are right, a very tiny small part of the population has this issue but that's why we are using RGB-B DMD.
⤷ James Childress : 
What exactly does RGB-B mean? I tried doing a web search and couldn't find anything on it.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
hello James, meaning that instead to have only 3 LED, we have a fourth one, Blue, to get much more brightness and color
Se Hwan Seong : 
Can I use it vertically which aim to the ceiling?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello, 
Vertically no, but reversed yes!
lik y li : 
Can we charging this projector with a 5V/2A input? 

If we power the projector with lower input power (5V 2A or 12V but not 3A), does it take supplement power from the internal battery? 

What's the operating power of the projector? 

Does it have manual focus control? 

Does it have optical zoom?

Is the internal battery removable?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello, 
For the power question, our R&D team is still working on this, we will get more info later.
- Manual Focus: we have auto focus and you can also manually customize it from the menu
- Optical zoom: yes
- Removable battery: no, removable batteries take much more space and in order to keep the product wrapped in a portable size, we needed to maximise the size of the battery by doing the same strategy as mobile phones.
Jason Andreas : 
Just wanting to ask - will the product ship with tracked (recorded) shipping? Also, is there any prospect of it shipping earlier than the estimated date?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Jason, 
Yes you will be able to track the package.
Concerning the date of shipping: we will post an update about this in September!

Alex H : 
will I still be able to use the projector if it's more than 125" away from the screen?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Alex, 
Yes, but we strongly suggest to stay below 120" diagonal in order to get a perfect contrast, color and brightness. You can go above this in a very dark room but we don't suggest it.

Oliver : 
@Christian Noack:  I actually _DO_ hope that the device displays 25Hz input video with a frame rate of 50Hz (i.e. doubling frames). A projection frame rate of 25Hz would flicker so much that I'd get a headache after a few minutes.

solidviper2000 : 
Will the LED bulb be replaceable?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hi There, 
The Philips PicoPix Max is powered by Texas Instrument DLP technology with LEDs that are rated to last over 30,000 hours. No need to replace it!
Martin Schubert : 
My main concern - as with any other project - is noise. Any high hissing sounds or very loud ones make those projectors not suitable for presentations. Are there any information about noise loudness (db) and if noise is something that is taken account into this project?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Martin, 
PicoPix Max has a very quiet internal fan. For 10 years, our engineers have been continuously improving our projectors to reduce fan noise like on the Screeneo U3. We’re very happy with how quiet our new line of projectors are, and we know you will be to.
⤷ Martin Schubert : 
Wonderful. Looking forward to it!
Oliver : 
Did I read that correctly: You support automatic keystone correction horizontally *AND* vertically, *BOTH* up to 45 degrees? And I assume this is „real“ optical correction (moving lens), not something done digitally by squeezing the display contents? Please confirm.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Oliver, 
The auto keystone correction is only for horizontal, not for vertical. The 4 corners correction is digital and can be customized in the system.
⤷ Oliver : 
Ok, thanks. But the maximum angle for the horizontal auto keystone is 45 degrees, right?

While we are pre-ordering PicoPix Max exclusively through Indiegogo, if you would like to see the full line of projectors, please check out https://www.usa.philips.com/c-m-so/projectors.

Habil Echaara : 
Hello,
With a position of 250 cm from the wall what will be the maximum size of the projection?

⤷ Philips Projection :
