RAULT Fabien : 
Hello,
Can you tel me please, if the PicoPix Max accepted audio tracks encoded in dolby digital, DTS, DTS HD master audio et dolby true HD ?
Thank you.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Dear Fabien, the source (your BD Player or gaming console) will do the decoding and if you want to play the image over the PicoPix Max and forward the 5.1 sound to your AV receiver, it will be possible to do it via optical out for eg. If your movie is played from the internet or your USB stick/MicroSD, VLC or Kodi will do the decoding. You won't be able to send the signal from the projector to an AV receiver because our device is not dedicated for home cinema like but portable and standalone.
lik y li : 
What type of thread does it use for the mount?  Is it the standard camera mount thread? can I use my own tripod?

What's the power input to the projector? 

How long is the power cable you have for the projector? Can you include a longer cable (5+ meter) so we can power the device without it being next to the socket.

Can you make an app so we could control the projector on an android phone?

Does the projector have an ECO mode to increase lamp and battery life?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello, 
We use a standard one same as for your camera. Our R&D team is still maximising the power input, should be around 45w but we are still fine tuning it.
The cable will be between 1 and 1.2 m long.
Concerning the APP, we will start to develop it in a second stage, we are now concentrating on the projector itself and the AirMote control.
Yes we have an Eco mode! This is not a lamp but a LED :-)

Netflix officially saying they need 1 million Android TV OS to get on board, so if Philips decide to go Android TV OS on the PP Max, Netflix and Amazon Prime would probably give the certifications. Just think forward.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
H B. Android TV doesn't give you a wide liberty compared to Android OS. For the moment we have chosen to build the PicoPix Max with Android OS.

Harald Lemke : 
Hi Team and thank you in advance. Would there be any issues having the PicoPix running 24hours a day  every day  all throughout the year? Thank you much in advance. All the best    Harald
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Harald, 
We are talking here about a portable device that is not targeting professional uses but more mainstream and nomad users. Nevertheless, the LED will last around 30,000 hours that should be enough.
⤷ Harald Lemke : 
Thank you for the fast response. The from factor counts in a doctor's waiting room to project a waterfall to the wall... any ideas about the unit heating up possibly too much in a 24 hour every day  all year  use? Thankx in advance. All the best. Harald
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Harald, this depend on the environment as well like if you have A/C in the room in summer. The heat will always be the same after 30mins, it doesn't increase.
⤷ Harald Lemke : 
Perfect. Thank you amazingly much ! :-)
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Welcome !!
Ewan Main :

⤷ Philips Projection : 
Ewan, yes! We have a digital zoom for that!
Matthew Sheppard : 
With regards to projecting on a white board, it should be simple to add an accelerometer to automatically move from landscape to portrait mode which is used on most tablets, or it could be a manual thing, but should be really simple to implement.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Matthew, yes you are right, but don't forget that this is a portable device. As we have our own launcher, it's now only a question of accelerometer but a question of UI, UX, and schedule. Knowing this, the percentage of customers using this feature will be below 5%.

Matthew Sheppard : 
With regards to VAT, surely as we are not "Buying" a product and instead "Investing" in the design/manufacture then these products are "Free" preproduction samples and as such tax free.

An example would be when these are manufactured in China, you pay tax on the cost of the item, not the cost once you resell it.

As this item is not yet available on the retail market, this further qualifies as a preproduction sample.

There is no benefit to charging us taxes when you are already making a profit
Matthew Sheppard : 
I already own a PPX4935, thats got an android remote app - works pretty well.

Hero : 
how is this compared to xgimi h1? i backed it up and i am not sure if this is better than my current xgimi h1.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hi Hero! Which Hero? :-)
Here are the main differences:
Display Technique: 0.47"DMD RGB-LED: we have RGB-B and the newest solution
Brightness: 900 Ansi Lumens: we have a bit less but better color management
Color gamut: more than 120%NTSC: impossible...
Contrast: 10000:1: same
Standard resolution: Full HD: same
Compatible resolution: 2K/4K Same
Projection ratio: 1.39 - 1.5 :1: we have 1.2
Keystone correction: Vertical: +-35, horizontal: +-33 :we have 45

RAM: 3GB DDR
⤷ Philips Projection : 
They don't a built in battery, nor:
Auto keystone, 4 corner correction, their size if really bigger and not transportable, no AirMote, no touchpad...
⤷ Hero : 
Thanks. 

How about the clarity of the picture?
Igor Panchernikov : 
Android TV OS  could make it even a better projector.
Travis Eli Goad : 
I'm curious why Phillips decided to do an indegogo campaign.  Company has many resources.  Why use a platform designed for startups?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Travis, 
We are debuting Philips PicoPix Max on Indiegogo because no one’s feedback is more important than yours. We want to work with you to create the best possible product we can. Your input and feedback will be directly reflected in how we continue to develop PicoPix Max and other products. With your help, we’re creating a revolutionary, unique home cinema experience.
Bose, Segway, Mozilla and other big players also did it.

⤷ Philips Projection :

Joerg Mosthaf : 
Asking again, as it hasn’t been answered: Is it possible to use it to project on the ceiling? Is the cooling functional when it is tilted to beam up?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Even if the the PicoPix Max can be fixed in the ceiling with a special screw, we remind you that this is a portable projector with a battery and get you the freedom to project everywhere! We use a standard tripod screw under the projector and suggest to fix it with a harness. Also, the fan throw air from the side.
⤷ Joerg Mosthaf : 
I don’t want to fix it to the ceiling - I want to tilt it up enough, to watch content on the ceiling while lying in bed :)
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hey Joerg, the Tripod as a moving head that can be adjusted to your need. You can project up to 45 degrees
Junhyeok Jeon : 
It would be great if can connect nintendo switch via one usb c cable like astro portable monitor. If can, switch user will love it.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello!
Our PicoPix Max has a USB-C input for video and another one for Power. You will be able to connect your switch via USB-C or HDMI.
⤷ Junhyeok Jeon : 
Does it mean I can connect switch without switch dock and extra power bank?
Some portable monitors have its own mini dock itself inside, it needs one usb c cable to use dock mode. but some monitor has usb c port but doesn’t have dock function to connect switch. So in this case, it needs switch dock, hdmi cable and extra power bank to connect switch. I’d like to confirm this one have dock integrated and also can supply enough power by built-in battery to connect switch with just one usb c cable
Alex H : 
I was wondering what the maximal distance between the projector and screen is?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Alex, 
The distance between the wall and the PicoPix Max is around 125" for a 120" diagonal
Nikunj Khetani : 
As this uses DLP tech, will it support 3d content playback?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Nikunj, 
Based on our 1000 people survey, around 86% of them answered that they are not using 3D anymore. This has been a trend for few years and now T manufacturers are even canceling this feature on some of their TV. We decided not to add this feature and keep working on other important enhancements.

understood.

Erdal Karaca :

⤷ Erdal Karaca :

⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Erdal, we are supporting ceiling and rear projection but not vertical 90 degrees. Concerning the colors: Android 9 supports ICC profiles and you can be able to implement whatever monochrome or color blind mode, also, we know some apps on the Store that can do those kind of features. For the projector screen, we actually thought about it but we want to let our backers buy the size they want in their favorite stores.

The Xgimi Z6 is not a smart projector and doesn't embed a battery. This is not a portable projector. More over, Philips is dedicated to image perfection since decades and we work with internal and external image professional to fine tune the colors to perfection. Don't forget that you will also get a 24 months Worldwide warranty and a call center to help you in case you need it.

Nicolas Laignelet : 
Just out of curiosity, I've seen some projectors on the market have a function to adjust the image if you don't put the projector right in front of the wall (at an angle), is it the case here ? For example can I put it on my nightstand on the side of my bed and project right in the middle ?
⤷ Nicolas Laignelet : 
Question answered by another great Nicolas, answer is yes. Cheers.
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Nicolas, The PicoPix Max has an automatic horizontal keystone and 4 corners correction that is done manually through the PicoPix Max software. The vertical keystone is done automatically!

Pao Borey :

Marcos Pianelli : 
So I've been researching a lot about portable projectors and I got impressed when your project claimed "800 ANSI Lumens", given the top max I've seen in a battery portable projector is 250 ANSI Lumens. So my question is if you are staying real ANSI lumens or just the normal "chinese" lumen that can be deceiving. 

Thanks in advance,

Marcos
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Dear Marcos

Our engineers have found that the term ANSI Lumens can vary from manufacturer to manufacturer. We are using the term Color Lumens as defined by our engineers to measure the real number of lumens based on the color/brightness/gamma adjustment settings we have defined in our lab. Essentially, Color Lumens = Lumens + More Vivid Color + Fine Tuned Picture Settings.
⤷ Marcos Pianelli : 
The term ANSI means standard so there is only one way to measure Lumens ANSI.  https://www.pcmag.com/encyclopedia/term/37802/ansi-lumen .
⤷ Marcos Pianelli : 
with 800 ANSI lumens as the standard defines would be bright enough to see clear the picture with windows open
⤷ Marcos Pianelli : 
Sounds like bad marketing, would like to know the real ANSI lumens of this device, there is only one way to test it and its a standard!
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Marcos, unfortunately you are right and wrong. Yes, there's a way to calculate it, a supposed "standard", but unfortunately, the whole industry leaders are using different kind of measurements. Several journalists already pointed out this issue. On our side, we believe that our measure is the closest from the reality. Sorry if this is not the answer you were expecting, but this is the reality.

Hello,

⤷ Philips Projection : 
Dear Francois, the perk at 399euros was for super early adopters and valid till yesterday. Now you can get access to our early bird at 419euros. Thanks!

mmancpa : 
I am excited to see in person how this performs. I have also contributed to another Pico projector on Indiegogo and plan a head-to-head competition.

The #1 weakness that jumped out at me was the internal storage. With the prices of various storage options on the market at cheap prices, 128GB should be the BARE minimum, but since this is video 256GB minimum with a 512GB option would make much more sense. I mean I have a S10+ phone with 1TB internal storage (yes retail $ is high).
⤷ Philips Projection : 
When we made the market's survey, we found out that more than 90% of Consumers only need 16GB memory or less.

But we did wanted to address the 10% left, this is why we added a MicroSD solution (and of course USB). 

Finally, we added all streaming features that will allow you to use your smartphone.
⤷ mmancpa : 
I believe that in the 90% that responded to lead you to a 16GB solution, probably 75% of those respondents don't understand storage needs for video, prices, etc. What is the max capacity of the SD Card slot, for if it's 512Gb or higher than that would alleviate most storage issues. But honestly in this day and age I feel that a 16GB internal memory solution is a cost cutting measure that can be measured probably in a few dollars. I personally like ability for high end internal storage.
Selka Faical : 
Totaly agree with Johan Smedberg comment 16 GB is to small we need a minimum of 128 GB
⤷ Philips Projection : 
When we made the market's survey, we found out that more than 90% of Consumers only need 16GB memory or less. But we did wanted to address the 10% left, this is why we added a MicroSD solution (and of course USB). Finally, we added all streaming features that will allow you to use your smartphone.

H B : 
What are the dimensions and weight of the product? Thanks
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hey, thanks for reaching out. PicoPix Max dimensions are: 5.35” x 5.28” x 1.87” or 136 x 134 x 47.5 cm and weighs in at 1.87 lbs or 850 grams. Let us know if you have further questions, thanks so much.

⤷ Philips Projection : 
Of course, you can use a special tripod to mount it on your ceiling. All video adjustments will be then made accordingly by the product to offer you the same picture's experience

Nova Upinel Altesse : 
Hi Philips,
How short can this projector throw?

Thanks!
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Nova, 

Thanks for your questions!
We have a 1.2:1 Texas Instrument DMD and you can project an image up to 120" at 125".
We added 2 USB-C ports: 1 for Charge and 1 for Video. This is really useful if you want to project with your laptop or iPad while charging the device with a real charger!
Looking forward receiving your order :)

Mathieu jobic : 
Hold on when you say we have to pay VAT, in france its 20% so final price will be 478 euro, thats a big bump, where do you get the delivery snce your company is in switzerland ? Will it be in switzerland ? If that the case if i receive it in switzerland will i pay VAT too ?

Dear Mathieu, 

The end user is always responsible for the VAT, you cannot buy a product in France at Boulanger or on Internet without the VAT. Even if we ship it to HK or Switerland, the State will always ask you for the VAT.
We are offering the shipping to all our client.
Thanks!

Christer Hansen Eriksen : 
Can you please explain Native Resolution 1080p vs 4K support? What does that actually mean? And your marketing material mentions 4KHDR10, but nowhere else is HDR specified. Can you please tell us more about it's HDR capabilities?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Christer, 

The Philips PicoPix Max will project an image in Full HD. If you plug an external BLuray player or Apple TV 4K, the signal will be 4K and the projector will project Full HD. 
Concerning HDR, the projector will decode HDR signal and adjust all colors like a TV
⤷ Christer Hansen Eriksen : 
Okay, I got the 4K part. No 4K support, you downscale it. Sneaky marketing.

Will the projector display an HDR image, or "convert" HDR to SDR? Your answer was not clear to me and I don't know what you mean by "adjust all colors like a TV". Please explain wether it has HDR capabilities or not. Your marketing material clearly is making that statement, but you're not backing that up anywhere else.

Neel Nathvani : 
Will this projector support 3D? What is the refresh rate?
⤷ Philips Projection : 
Hello Will, 

The projector doesn't support 3D. We made survey on 1,000 users and 87% of them are not using 3D anymore.
The refresh rate is 60fps in 1080p.
